author: Daniele Ferrari

text:
â€˜Truth and justice are on our sideâ€™ â€“ Putin
Russia remains an unbreakable barrier against Nazism, Russophobia, and anti-Semitism, the president has said 

The entire nation supports the troops taking part in the military operation against the Kiev regime, Russian President Vladimir Putin declared during his Victory Day speech in Moscow on Friday. The country stands as an unbreakable barrier against Nazism, Russophobia, and anti-Semitism, with â€œtruth and justice on our side,â€ he added.

This yearâ€™s event marks the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany in World War II.

Addressing an audience of veterans, military personnel, visiting foreign heads of state, and citizens, the president linked the Soviet Unionâ€™s historic fight against Nazism to Russiaâ€™s current military efforts.

Putin emphasized that the nation will continue to defend its sovereignty, values, and historical legacy against what he described as modern manifestations of aggressive and destructive ideologies. Moscow has long accused Kiev of adhering to Nazi ideology.

â€œTruth and justice are on our side. The whole of Russia, our society and all people supportâ€ our soldiers, the president said. He reminded that â€œOur fathers, grandfathers and great-grandfathers saved the Fatherlandâ€ and entrusted the current generation to defend it. â€œTo be united, to firmly defend our national interests, our thousand-year history, culture, traditional values. Everything that is dear to us, that is sacred to us.â€

Putin also warned against attempts to rewrite the history of World War II, vowing that Russia would preserve the truth about the Soviet Unionâ€™s decisive role in defeating Nazism.

â€œOur duty is to defend the honor of the Red Army soldiers and commanders, and the heroism of fighters of different ethnic backgrounds who will forever remain Russian soldiers in world history,â€ he said.

The president recalled the decisive Soviet victories in key World War II battles, including Moscow, Stalingrad, and Kursk, and paid tribute to the resilience of besieged cities such as Leningrad. He highlighted the shared sacrifices of all Soviet republics.

Concluding his address, Putin called on Russians to remain steadfast and united in the face of modern challenges, invoking the spirit of sacrifices that brought peace eight decades ago. â€œWe honor every veteran of the Great Patriotic War and bow our heads in remembrance of all who gave their lives for Victory,â€ he said, as the country marked one of its most solemn and significant national holidays.
author: Forbidden News

text:
Yesterdayâ€™s conclusions from the Brussels summit of European leaders brought unity and new hope for Ukraine. After a long period of uncertainty and dynamic developments, this is positive news for Ukraine, for Europe, and for the entire world.

Europe standsâ€”and will continue to standâ€”with Ukraine, regardless of the White Houseâ€™s stance. The EU supports Ukraineâ€™s independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity. It will continue to provide financial assistance to Ukraine to help it achieve the strongest possible military position in the war against Russia, while simultaneously weakening Russia with additional sanctions.

Regarding financial aid to Ukraine, I was very happy by Norwayâ€™s stance. Norway, which has the worldâ€™s largest sovereign wealth fund with assets worth $1.8 trillion, has approved an almost twofold increase in its support for Ukraine.

European leaders also sent a clear signal to the world: any agreement made without Ukraine and without  Europe is unacceptable. A sustainable peace must be backed by credible and significant security guarantees for Ukraineâ€”the only thing that can deter any future threats from Russia.

ReArm Europe

European leaders have agreed on â€œReArm Europe,â€ a strategic defense plan. In response to the uncertainty surrounding U.S. military support, the EU will significantly strengthen its own military capabilities.

ReArm is a massive step forward in building the EUâ€™s defense capacity. It will mobilize over â‚¬800 billion to reinforce European defense.

Raising such a financial package will require key measures, such as suspending the EUâ€™s budgetary rules. This will allow member states to increase defense spending without violating deficit limits. Additionally, existing EU fundsâ€”including cohesion fundsâ€”will be redirected toward defense.

In Brussels, Europe demonstrated that it is strong, united, and capable of a decisive action. Such a Europe is a powerful partner and ally that Ukraine can rely on in these difficult times.

European Union in Ukraine
author: Katarina Mathernova

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Trumpâ€™s Exit Plan: Will Ukraine and Europe Be Left to Face Russia Alone?

ğŸš¨ Breaking Insight: A year ago, I warned: â€œThe Americans will leave Ukrainians fighting with sticks.â€ Now, it seems the U.S. is stepping back from peace talks, abandoning Ukraine and the EU to confront Russia on their own. This could mean a longer, deadlier war. 

ğŸ” Whatâ€™s Happening:
U.S. Withdrawal: Signs point to the U.S. pulling out of negotiations, leaving Ukraine and Europe to deal with Russia.

Trumpâ€™s Strategy - Analysts believe Trump wants to:

Save U.S. money by cutting support. ğŸ’¸Weaken Europe by fueling conflict with Russia.Let the EU and Russia clash, benefiting U.S. interests.Distance himself from Ukraine, which he doesnâ€™t care about. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦

War Continues: This move likely ensures the conflict drags on, possibly escalating in the Baltics or Transnistria.

ğŸ’¥ Why It Matters:
Europeâ€™s Dilemma: EU leaders privately admit prosperity depends on Russia ties, but fear speaking out. Recent elections in Moldova and Romania show citizensâ€™ voices are being ignored.

Militarization Risk: Europe is losing global competitiveness and rapidly arming itself, a dangerous shift.

Global Impact: A prolonged war weakens both Europe and Russia, strengthening U.S. dominance while Ukraine suffers.

ğŸŒ Whatâ€™s Next?
Best Case: A surprise breakthrough brings peace against all odds.
Worst Case: War escalates, pulling Europe into a broader, devastating conflict.
Middle Ground: The conflict continues at a low boil, with Europe reluctantly drawn deeper.

ğŸ“£ What Do You Think?
Is Trump abandoning Ukraine to weaken Europe, or is this just a hardline strategy? Share your thoughts! ğŸ’¬ #UkraineWar #TrumpStrategy #Europe #Russia #Timewellspent

text: Russian lawmakers on Tuesday voted to ban the advocacy of child-free lifestyles. The move is part of a broader effort by the Kremlin to reverse a falling birthrate and promote the country as a defender of traditional values battling the West.
author: The New York Times

text:
Deputy Secretary of Russiaâ€™s Security Council Aleksei Shevtsov said that CIS and CSTO member states share Russiaâ€™s commitment to defending â€œtraditional spiritual and moral values.â€ Speaking about Russiaâ€™s like-minded partners, Shevtsov also mentioned Georgia.

Aleksei Shevtsov: â€œAlthough the peoples and countries of the CIS are all different, we share many things in common. Above all, it is our commitment to traditional spiritual and moral values. One of the priorities of our foreign policy activity is to promote the image of the Russian Federation as a guardian and defender of traditional spiritual and moral values. In this regard, Russia has many like-minded partners among the CIS, BRICS, and CSTO countries.

The countries of the South Caucasus, like the CIS as a whole, are facing increasing pressure from Westerners seeking to impose their destructive values.

In Georgia, the authorities have found both the strength and the means to resist the onslaught on traditional ways of life and the attempts to introduce pseudo-values such as LGBT, which are completely incompatible with the peoples of the Caucasus.

Russian legislation that protects traditional values should also be applied across the CIS space, primarily as legislative experience. Our countryâ€™s main legal frameworks â€” the Constitution and the National Security Strategy â€” affirm this commitment to traditional values. There are also specific laws, such as those improving the regulation of non-profit organisations.â€

text:
#BreakingNews 
Journalist Who Called Macronâ€™s Wife a Man Seeks Asylum in Russia.

Natacha Rey, the French journalist who alleged that Brigitte Macron, wife of French President Emmanuel Macron, was born a man, is reportedly seeking political asylum in Russia. Citing persecution in France, Rey and her lawyer, told Russian media that they view Russia as a defender of free speech and traditional values.

Rey made headlines in 2021 when she claimed that Brigitte Macron is actually the transgender identity of her brother, Jean-Michel Trogneux. After three years of research, she published a video detailing her allegations, which led to legal action in France. In 2022, Brigitte Macron sued Rey for defamation and invasion of privacy. A Paris court later fined the journalist and ordered her to pay â‚¬8,000 ($8,200) in damages.

Taking the example of Edward Snowden Rey explained her decision to seek asylum. Rey told Russian newspaper Izvestia that she sees Russia as a â€œgreat democracyâ€ compared to France, which she accused of suppressing free speech and political opposition. â€œRussia has been a victim of a disinformation campaign and unjustified attacks by European and American media for decades,â€ she claimed.

Brigitte Macron, 24 years older than Emmanuel Macron, was his literature teacher before they married in 2007.

text:
Three Bushmaster Protected Mobility Vehicles were loaded onto a C-17A at RAAF Base Amberley today for delivery to #Ukraine. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦

The Australian Government is supporting the Government of Ukraine by providing 20 Bushmasters, including two of the ambulance variants, to aid Ukraineâ€™s response to Russiaâ€™s illegal aggression.

The Australian-built Bushmasters enable soldiers to move safely to a battle area before dismounting for close combat. The Bushmaster Protected Mobility Vehicle is well suited to provide protection to the Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers and Ukrainian civilians against mines and improvised explosive devices, shrapnel from artillery and small-arms fire.

The vehicles have been painted olive green to suit the operating environment. Additionally, a Ukrainian flag is painted on either side with the words â€œUnited with Ukraineâ€ stencilled in English and Ukrainian to acknowledge our commitment and support to the Government and people of Ukraine. The ambulances will have the traditional red cross emblem.

The Bushmaster Protected Mobility Vehicles are fitted with radios, a global positioning system and additional bolt-on armour to increase their protection.

text:
Ukraine's independence was restored 34 years ago. But our statehood is much older. 

It is rooted in over a thousand years of political tradition â€“ from the era of medieval Rus, where Christianity was adopted and the trident emblem originated.

Through kingdoms, the Cossack state, early republics, and struggles under imperial and Soviet rule, Ukrainians preserved their identity. 

Today, Ukraineâ€™s sovereignty shines brightly as the nation defends its freedom and centuries-old heritage against Russiaâ€™s war of aggression.
